member.name: T:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SelfTestMode
member.summary: Specifies which mode to use when performing a self-test operation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SelfTestMode.Basic
member.summary: A basic self-test should complete in under 3 seconds. At minimum, a basic self-test verifies host-device communication (for example: validation of device registers).
member.remarks: This mode does not require you to disconnect devices from external equipment because the states of I/O lines are maintained throughout the test.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SelfTestMode.Intermediate
member.summary: An intermediate self-test should complete in under 30 seconds and try to verify as much I/O as possible using internal loop-backs.
member.remarks: This mode does not require you to disconnect devices from external equipment because the states of I/O lines are maintained throughout the test.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SelfTestMode.Full
member.summary: A full self-test verifies as much I/O as possible and takes longer to complete. This advanced test is used to perform the most exhaustive diagnostic possible.
member.remarks: This mode requires you to disconnect external I/O signals before starting the operation.

member.summary: Sets the link name provided by another resource (such as a chassis).
member.value: A string that represents the link name.

member.summary: Sets the bus type inside the chassis.
member.value: Set this property to filter resources accordingly.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.Filter.VendorId
member.summary: Sets the bus-defined vendor ID of the device.
member.value: Set this property to filter resources accordingly.
member.remarks: Example: For NI, PXI/PCI is 0x1093 and USB is 0x3293. For PXI/PCI resources, this refers to the Subsystem Vendor ID (SVID) if it is nonzero; otherwise, this refers to the Vendor ID (VID). For USB resources, this refers to the Vendor ID (VID). For VXI resources, this refers to the VXI Manufacturer ID.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.Filter.ProductId
member.summary: Sets the bus-specific product identifier code. This ID is not the product's sellable model number.
member.value: Set this property to filter resources accordingly.
member.remarks: For PXI/PCI resources, if the Subsystem Vendor ID is nonzero, this refers to the Subsystem ID (SSID); otherwise, this refers to the Device ID (DID). For USB resources, this refers to the Product ID (PID). For VXI resources, this refers to the VXI Model Code.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.ProductResource.SelfCalibrate
member.summary: Performs a self-calibration on a device.

remarks.para: The new calibration constants are defined with respect to the calibration constants created during an external calibration to ensure that the measurements are traceable to these external standards. The new calibration constants do not affect the constants created during an external calibration because they are stored in a different area of the device memory.
You can perform a self-calibration at any time to adjust the device for use in environments other than those in which the device was externally calibrated.

member.exception: An error occurred within the System Configuration internal library.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SystemConfiguration
member.summary: Represents a session into a remote system or network device that has NI System Configuration software installed.

remarks.para: This is the main class of the .NET API. It contains the means to communicate to a remote system or network device running NI System Configuration software.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SystemConfiguration.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a system configuration session with a specific system.
member.param: The system to open a session to.

remarks.para: The can be specified as an IP address, MAC address, or DNS name of the target on a local or Real-Time system. Examples of a local system include the following values: , an empty string, the string localhost, or 127.0.0.1.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SystemConfiguration.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a system configuration session with a specific system, including the system target name, user name, and password specified.
member.param: The system to open a session to.
The username for the system you are initializing.
The password for the system you are initializing.

remarks.para: The can be specified as an IP address, MAC address, or DNS name of the target on a local or Real-Time system. Examples of a local system include the following values: , an empty string, the string localhost, or 127.0.0.1.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SystemConfiguration.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a system configuration session with a specific system, including the system target name, user name, password, timeout, and refresh behavior specified.
member.param: The system to open a session to.
The username for the system you are initializing.
The password for the system you are initializing.
Specifies the time, in milliseconds, that the method waits before the operation times out.
Forces properties to refresh every time they are read by default.

remarks.para: The can be specified as an IP address, MAC address, or DNS name of the target on a local or Real-Time system. Examples of a local system include the following values: , an empty string, the string localhost, or 127.0.0.1.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SystemConfiguration.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.Language,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Initializes a system configuration session with a specific system, including the system target name, user name, password, refresh behavior, language, and offline status specified.
member.param: The system to open a session to.
The username for the system you are initializing.
The password for the system you are initializing.
Specifies the time, in milliseconds, that the method waits before the operation times out.
Forces properties to refresh every time they are read by default.
Specifies the language.

param.name: isOffline
param.para: Indicates whether the target is offline.
If the value is , initialization succeeded but the target is offline. Only cached system properties are available.

remarks.para: The can be specified as an IP address, MAC address, or DNS name of the target on a local or Real-Time system. Examples of a local system include the following values: , an empty string, the string localhost, or 127.0.0.1.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.SystemConfiguration.GenerateMAXReport(NationalInstruments.SystemConfiguration.ReportType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a report to document a local or remote system.
member.param: Specifies the type of report to generate.
Specifies the filename of the generated report. You must have the correct extension for the type of report to generate. The options are .xml, .htm, .html, and .zip.
If , saves the new output file over an older file of the same name.

remarks.para: Reports can be generated in three formats: XML, HTML, and technical support reports. Both HTML and XML formats provide readable reports. The XML format makes archiving and comparing reports convenient with a configuration management tool. The technical support format generates a ZIP file containing reports that are useful if you need to contact National Instruments Technical Support. The level of support for this method depends on each device's driver software.
This method provides a one-way export only. You cannot import the XML-based report into MAX.
