members.member:
ItemURI is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16777216 (0x01000000)
This specifies a fully-qualified nisysapi item including the hostname and one or more experts and items.
This exists for all items, experts should not set this. The System API expert should set DriverItemName0 rather than this value. The framework will set/modify this value before passing it to the client.

LastConflict is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16830464 (0x0100D000)
This specifies the ID of the most recent tag for which multiple experts returned different values.
This exists for all items, experts should not set this. The framework sets this whenever there is a merge conflict in any of these functions: SearchForItemsAndProperties, GetPropertiesOfItem, and MergePropertyBags. If there is no merge conflict, then the framework will set it to 0.

ItemIsDevice is of type Bool Tag value: 16781312 (0x01001000)
Specifies whether the item is a device.
Required for all devices. A device in this context is known across NI by many other names: VXI and GPIB groups have devices (eg, USB-VXI and PCI-GPIB) that they call controllers or interfaces. The Serial group has a device (eg, ENET-232) that it calls a server box. If the host PC communicates with it over an industry standard bus, it's a device. If it has a serial number and exposes diagnostic functionality, it's a device. If the expert does not set this property, then the framework will set it to FALSE. It is possible for an item to be both a device and a chassis.

ItemIsChassis is of type Bool Tag value: 16941056 (0x01028000)
Specifies whether the item is a chassis.
Required for all chassis. A chassis in this context is something that has numbered slots and an enclosure that modules or devices plug into. If this item provides only an external physical connection for a cable or accessory, this property should be FALSE. An item can supply ProvidesBusType and ProvidesLinkName without being a chassis. If the expert does not set this property, then the framework will set it to FALSE. It is possible for an item to be both a device and a chassis.

ConnectsToBusType is of type UnsignedInt (AttrBusType) Tag value: 16785408 (0x01002000)
Specifies the bus type that a device plugs into.
Required for all devices and chassis. For a device, this is the bus type that it plugs into. For a chassis, this may be BuiltInSystem. You may think of this attribute as the "parent" or "uplink" bus type. The value of this property implies the existence of other properties: Example: if this is PciPxi then it must have PCI bus/dev/func. Example: if this is Usb then it must have USB interface number. This property paired with ConnectsToLinkName specifies a unique connection.

ProvidesBusType is of type UnsignedInt (AttrBusType) Tag value: 16932864 (0x01026000)
Specifies the bus type by which devices connect to the controller or chassis.
Required for all chassis. For a device, this may also make sense if it is a converter box (eg, PCI-232 or ENET-GPIB). For a chassis, this is the type of bus inside the chassis. This property paired with ProvidesLinkName specifies a unique connection.

VendorNumber is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16789504 (0x01003000)
Specifies the bus-specific vendor ID of the device.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI, USB, FlexAdapter, FireWire, VXI, and any other device in a chassis. The value has bus-specific meaning. For PCI/PXI devices, this depends on whether the device has a Subsystem Vendor ID (SVID): If your device DOES implement SVID, use the Subsystem Vendor ID (SVID) as the VendorNumber. If your device DOES NOT implement SVID, use the Vendor ID (VID) as the VendorNumber. For USB resources, this refers to the Vendor ID (VID). For VXI resources, this refers to the VXI Manufacturer ID.

VendorName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16793600 (0x01004000)
Specifies the name of the manufacturer that created the item.
Required for all devices and chassis. The value of this property is intended for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions. If the value is unknown it should be an empty string.

ModelNumber is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16797696 (0x01005000)
Specifies the bus-specific product identifier code.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI, USB, FlexAdapter, VXI, and any other device in a chassis. This is neither the NI sellable model number nor the NI-DNA code. The value has bus-specific meaning. For PCI/PXI, this depends on whether the device has a Subsystem Vendor ID (SVID): If your device DOES implement SVID, use the Subsystem ID (SSID) as the ModelNumber. If your device DOES NOT implement SVID, use the Device ID (DID) as the ModelNumber. For USB, this refers to the Product ID (PID). For VXI, this refers to the VXI Model Code.

HardwareCodeNIDNA is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17031168 (0x0103E000)
Optional for NI devices and chassis. This field is defined internally at NI, type your product name into this page: http://venus.ni.com/eng/utf8/nilm_web_search.search_screen?p_disp=ProductData Select your product by clicking on the link. The HardwareID field on the right side of that new page is the value for this field.

ModelName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16801792 (0x01006000)
Specifies the model name of the item.
Required for all devices and chassis. Unlike the ModelNumber property, this value contains the sellable model number. The value of this property is intended for display purposes only and not for programmatic decisions. If the value is unknown it should be an empty string.

SerialNumber is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16805888 (0x01007000)
Specifies the serial number of this item.
Required for all devices. The preferred format is 8 hexadecimal digits without an "x". If it is 0xAB12 then you should represent it as "0000AB12". It is perfectly legal for the serial number to be longer and/or contain other characters. If the value is 0 (such as for a simulated device) or unknown it should be an empty string.

IsProductNI is of type Bool Tag value: 16809984 (0x01008000)
Specifies whether this item is a National Instruments product.
Required for all devices and chassis.

SimulatedVirtual is of type Bool Tag value: 16814080 (0x01009000)
Specifies whether the item is simulated, meaning it is not a physical entity.
Optional for all devices and chassis. If the expert does not set this property, then the framework will set it to FALSE.

ConnectsToLinkName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16818176 (0x0100A000)
Specifies the link name provided by another item (such as a chassis).
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI, FlexAdapter, VXI, and any other device in a chassis. You may think of this attribute as the "parent" or "uplink" chassis into which it is plugged. The format of this name is bus-specific and is defined as follows: For PXI this should be of the form "PXI1" or whatever the chassis number is. For cDAQ or SCXI this should be the DAQ name for the chassis. For VXI this should be the VISA resource name for the corresponding BACKPLANE. For GPIB this should be of the form "GPIB1" or whatever the board number is. This can be used for other bus types if one item provides a link that others connect to. If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be an empty string.

ProvidesLinkName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16936960 (0x01027000)
Specifies a link name to which other items connect.
Required for all chassis. The format of this name is bus-specific and is defined as follows: For PXI this should be of the form "PXI1" or whatever the chassis number is. For cDAQ or SCXI this should be the DAQ name for the chassis. For VXI this should be the VISA resource name for the corresponding BACKPLANE. For GPIB this should be of the form "GPIB1" or whatever the board number is. This can be used for other bus types if one item provides a link that others connect to. If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be an empty string.

SlotNumber is of type Int Tag value: 16822272 (0x0100B000)
Specifies the slot in which this device resides.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI, VXI, and any other device in a chassis. This is the identifier of the slot where the item is plugged in. For multi-slot devices, this should be the slot number to which the device is physically connected. If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be -1.

ProvidesNumSlots is of type Int Tag value: 16826368 (0x0100C000)
Specifies the number of slots that exist in the chassis.
Required for all chassis. If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be -1.

ConnectsToNumSlots is of type Int Tag value: 17072128 (0x01048000)
Specifies how many actual numbered slots the device occupies.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI (as of schema 5.0). This does not include unnumbered slots, such as the space occupied by system controllers. If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be -1.

ProvidesFirstSlotNumber is of type Int Tag value: 17018880 (0x0103B000)
Specifies the lowest numbered slot in the chassis.
Required for all chassis (as of schema 1.1). In general the first slot number is either 0 (VXI) or 1 (PXI).

FirmwareRevision is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16969728 (0x0102F000)
Specifies the firmware version information for this item.
Optional for all devices and chassis. This is the current firmware version for the item (as opposed to available versions). If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be an empty string.

SupportCalAny is of type Bool Tag value: 16908288 (0x01020000)
Specifies whether the device supports any calibration (internal and/or external).
Optional for all devices. All other calibration properties are qualified by this one. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be FALSE. An expert should not populate other calibration properties until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

CalIntSupport is of type Bool Tag value: 16842752 (0x01010000)
Specifies whether the device supports internal/self calibration.
Required for devices if SupportCalAny is TRUE. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be FALSE.

CalIntLastTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 16846848 (0x01011000)
Specifies the last time the device was self-calibrated.
Required for devices if CalIntSupport is TRUE. If the time is unknown, set all fields of this mxSysAttrTimestampUTC to zero (January 1, 1904).

CalIntLastTempC is of type Double Tag value: 16850944 (0x01012000)
Specifies the onboard device temperature in Celsius the last time the device was self-calibrated.
Optional for devices if CalIntSupport is TRUE. If the temperature is unknown, omit it from the property bag. If this property does not exist in a property bag then it may be exposed to customers as N/A or NaN.

CalIntExpire is of type Timestamp Tag value: 16855040 (0x01013000)
Specifies the next time the device needs internal/self calibration.
Because this is deprecated, experts should no longer set this property.

CalExtSupport is of type Bool Tag value: 16859136 (0x01014000)
Specifies whether the device supports external calibration.
Required for devices if SupportCalAny is TRUE. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be FALSE.

CalExtLastTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 16863232 (0x01015000)
Specifies the last time the device was externally calibrated (i.e. verified).
Required for devices if CalExtSupport is TRUE. Some older products do not store the verification date separately from the adjustment date, in which case the last adjustment date may be used. If CalExtSupportsWrite is TRUE, this property is writable; clients must also set CalExtPassword before saving. If the time is unknown, set all fields of this mxSysAttrTimestampUTC to zero (January 1, 1904).

CalExtLastVerifyOrAdjustTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 17203200 (0x01068000)
Specifies the last time the device was externally calibrated or adjusted.
Because this is deprecated, experts should no longer set this property.

CalExtLastTempC is of type Double Tag value: 16867328 (0x01016000)
Specifies the onboard device temperature in Celsius during the last external calibration adjustment.
Optional for devices if CalExtSupport is TRUE. This temperature may be omitted if it is not applicable for the product, not supported by the driver, or not beneficial to customers. If this property does not exist in a property bag then it may be exposed to customers as N/A or NaN.

CalExtNextTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 16871424 (0x01017000)
Specifies the due date for the next external calibration.
Required for devices if CalExtSupport is TRUE. If CalExtSupportsWrite is TRUE, this property is writable; clients must also set CalExtPassword before saving. The user can optionally clear due date by saving this as a blank timestamp. If last calibration time is unknown or cleared by the user, set all fields of this mxSysAttrTimestampUTC to zero (January 1, 1904).

CalExtRecommendedInterval is of type Int Tag value: 17207296 (0x01069000)
Specifies the manufacturer-recommended calibration interval in months.
Required for devices if CalExtSupport is TRUE (as of schema 14.0). If this interval is unknown, set it to -1.

CalExtUserInterval is of type Int Tag value: 17211392 (0x0106A000)
Specifies the user-defined external calibration interval.
Because this is deprecated, experts should no longer set this property.

CalMiscComments is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16961536 (0x0102D000)
Specifies user-defined comments associated with the last external calibration.
Optional for devices if CalExtSupport is TRUE.

CalExtSupportsWrite is of type Bool Tag value: 17215488 (0x0106B000)
Specifies whether users can write the external calibration timestamps and a new calibration password.
Optional for devices if CalExtSupport is TRUE. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be FALSE.

CalExtSupportsPassword is of type Bool Tag value: 17219584 (0x0106C000)
Specifies whether the expert supports password protection on the writable calibration information.
Because this is deprecated, experts should no longer set this property.

CalExtPassword is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17223680 (0x0106D000)
Specifies the current calibration password for this device.
Clients must set this before saving password-protected calibration information. In ValidatePropertyChanges, experts should compare this password against the calibration password stored on the device. If the client does not set this property, the expert should treat it as a blank password. If the passwords do not match, the expert must return E_SYSAPI_INV_CAL_CREDENTIALS. This property is write-only and experts should not put it in the property bag.

CalExtNewPassword is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17227776 (0x0106E000)
Specifies a new calibration password for this device.
Clients must also set CalExtPassword to the current password before saving this change. This property is write-only and experts should not put it in the property bag.

PciPxiBus is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16875520 (0x01018000)
Specifies the PCI bus number of the PXI/PCI device.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI. These fields provide extra "unique" IDs to help determine duplicate items for PCI/PXI. These numbers are not necessarily persistent and are reevaluated on each system reboot. For simulated devices and PXI controllers this should be 0.

PciPxiDevice is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16879616 (0x01019000)
Specifies the PCI device number of the PXI/PCI device.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI. These fields provide extra "unique" IDs to help determine duplicate items for PCI/PXI. These numbers are not necessarily persistent and are reevaluated on each system reboot. For simulated devices and PXI controllers this should be 0.

PciPxiFunction is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16883712 (0x0101A000)
Specifies the PCI function number of the PXI/PCI device.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI. These fields provide extra "unique" IDs to help determine duplicate items for PCI/PXI. These numbers are not necessarily persistent and are reevaluated on each system reboot. The function number is usually 0 for most NI products.

PciPxiLWidthActual is of type Int Tag value: 16973824 (0x01030000)
Specifies the PXIe/PCIe link width negotiated between the PCI Express host controller and the device.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI (as of schema 1.1). These fields provide link width information for PCI/PXI Express devices. Common values include 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16. This should not be confused with the link speed. For PCI/PXI devices that are not Express devices, these fields must be -1.

PciPxiLWidthMax is of type Int Tag value: 16977920 (0x01031000)
Specifies the maximum PXIe/PCIe link width of the device.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI (as of schema 1.1). These fields provide link width information for PCI/PXI Express devices. Common values include 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16. This should not be confused with the link speed. For PCI/PXI devices that are not Express devices, these fields must be -1.

PciPxiLWidthSlot is of type Int Tag value: 16982016 (0x01032000)
Specifies the PXIe/PCIe link width of the PXI Express peripheral slot in which the device resides.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI (as of schema 1.1). These fields provide link width information for PCI/PXI Express devices. Common values include 1, 4, and 8. This should not be confused with the link speed. For PCI/PXI devices that are not Express devices, these fields must be -1.

PciPxiTrigBusNumber is of type Int Tag value: 17035264 (0x0103F000)
Specifies the number of the trigger bus segment in the PXI chassis in which this device exists.
Optional for these devices: PCI/PXI. For PCI devices, this field must be -1. For PXI, if the chassis is unknown or unconfigured, this field should also be -1.

UsbInterface is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 16887808 (0x0101B000)
Specifies the USB interface number of this item.
Required for these devices: USB. This field provides an extra unique ID to help determine duplicate items for USB. The USB interface number is usually 0 for most NI products.

TcpPrimaryHostname is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16928768 (0x01025000)
Specifies the host name of the device.
Required for these devices: TCP/IP. This may be a simple hostname (foo), FQDN (foo.natinst.com), or IP (10.0.1.2). Which format depends on how the expert and its API actually refer to the device.

TcpNumberOfAddr is of type Int Tag value: 16953344 (0x0102B000)
Specifies how many IPv4 addresses the expert has for this device.
Required for these devices: TCP/IP. This is the number of IPv4 addresses the device has.

TcpAddrIP0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16957440 (0x0102C000)
Specifies all of the IPv4 addresses the expert has for this device.
Required for these devices: TCP/IP. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. TcpNumberOfAddr-1 This is always in dotted notation (10.0.1.2).

TcpDefaultPrimaryMAC is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16986112 (0x01033000)
Specifies the unique identifier (MAC address) for the device.
Required for these devices: TCP/IP (as of schema 1.1). Rebooting or reformatting the target should not cause this value to change. The MAC address is represented in standard notation (01:02:03:AB:CD:EF). If the value is unknown it should be an empty string.

TcpCanMergeUsingMAC is of type Bool Tag value: 16990208 (0x01034000)
Specifies whether the given item can be merged with other items sharing the MAC.
Optional for these devices: TCP/IP. This is useful if you have multiple equivalent peer items at the same address. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be TRUE.

GpibPrimary is of type Int Tag value: 16994304 (0x01035000)
Specifies the primary address of this GPIB item.
Required for these devices: GPIB (as of schema 1.1).

GpibSecondary is of type Int Tag value: 16998400 (0x01036000)
Specifies the secondary address of this GPIB item.
Required for these devices: GPIB (as of schema 1.1). If the GPIB item does not have a secondary address, the value is -1. If the GPIB item does have a secondary address, this is 0-based (not the bus SAD).

SerialPortBinding is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17076224 (0x01049000)
Specifies the OS-defined serial port binding.
Required for these devices: Serial (as of schema 5.0). This is OS-specific, e.g. "COM1" on Windows or "/dev/ttya" on Linux

NumberOfDrivers is of type Int Tag value: 16891904 (0x0101C000)
Specifies the number of experts that contribute to this item.
Required for all items.

DriverItemName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16896000 (0x0101D000)
Specifies the resource name used by the expert to identify this item.
Required for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. The item name is unique to a given expert but not necessarily across experts. The name does not necessarily have to be meaningful to users, but it is visible in the public API. At a given time on a system, the expert should ensure that the name is consistent across processes. It is invalid for an expert to create arbitrary names for the same item each time it is initialized. Best practices include the name being a key (such as an MXS GUID) or an entry in your configuration file. While it is recommended that the name be preserved across a system reboot, this is not required.

DriverWeight0 is of type Int Tag value: 16949248 (0x0102A000)
Specifies the relative weight of each expert for this item.
Required for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. The weight will determine how the System API determines the expert's order in the URI. A larger positive weight will make this driver's presence come earlier. It is valid for an expert to use different weights for different item types. Experts should populate this information on the following page: http://niweb.natinst.com/confluence/x/xyESB#NISystemConfigurationandSystemAPIFramework-SystemAPIExperts

DriverProgName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16900096 (0x0101E000)
Specifies the programmatic name for the expert that owns this item.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. If the expert does not set DriverProgName0, the framework sets it. This is the expert's programmatic name the user sees, such as "daqmx" or "ni-visa". Experts should populate this information on the following page: http://niweb.natinst.com/confluence/x/xyESB#NISystemConfigurationandSystemAPIFramework-SystemAPIExperts

DriverUserAlias0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 16904192 (0x0101F000)
Specifies the user-defined friendly name for this item.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. If the expert does not set DriverUserAlias0, the framework sets it to an empty string. The alias should make sense to the user and preferably is something the user can change by calling RenameAlias.

DriverUniqueID0 is of type Guid Tag value: 16916480 (0x01022000)
Specifies the ID the expert uses to uniquely identify the item over time.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. If the expert does not set DriverUniqueID0, the framework sets it to GUID_NULL.

DriverSysapiSchema0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17002496 (0x01037000)
Specifies the nisysapi schema the expert built against.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. To set DriverSysapiSchema0 from your expert, use "mxSysAttrVersion_Current" as the value. If the expert does not set DriverSysapiSchema0, the framework sets it to 0x00010000 (1.0).

HasDriver is of type Int (HasDriver) Tag value: 16920576 (0x01023000)
Specifies whether there is an installed driver for this item.
Optional for all devices and chassis. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be Installed (1).

IsPresentStatus is of type Int (IsPresentStatus) Tag value: 16924672 (0x01024000)
Specifies whether this item is currently present.
Optional for all devices and chassis. Set this to Unknown if you are not sure whether the device is presently connected/online. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be Present.

ItemHasService is of type Bool Tag value: 17006592 (0x01038000)
Specifies whether an item provides one of the defined service types.
Required for all services. If this is set to TRUE, the IsDevice and IsChassis tags are both allowed to be FALSE.

NumberOfServices is of type Int Tag value: 17010688 (0x01039000)
Specifies the number of defined service types for this item.
Required for all services. The framework will append services together for items it merges.

ServiceType0 is of type UnsignedInt (ServiceType) Tag value: 17014784 (0x0103A000)
Specifies the defined service types for this item.
Required for all services. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfServices-1. This is the defined NI service type from the enumeration. Each service type will likely also define its own additional properties.

SystemDeviceClass is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17022976 (0x0103C000)
Specifies the class for the remote system or network device.
Required for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 1.1). This is the defined NI device class for a target (e.g., PXI or cRIO). If the value is unknown it should be an empty string.

SystemUserComment is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17027072 (0x0103D000)
Specifies a user-defined comment for a remote system or network device.
Required for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 1.1). If the value is unknown it should be an empty string.

LastSystemShutdown is of type UnsignedInt (ShutdownType) Tag value: 17039360 (0x01040000)
Specifies the reason the system last shut down or restarted.
Required for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 1.2). If the value is not known, set it to "Normal".

NumSyncConnections is of type Int Tag value: 17043456 (0x01041000)
Specifies the number of synchronization connections a device has.
Optional for all devices. This value is usually 0 or 1. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be 0.

ConnectsToSyncTypes is of type UnsignedInt (SyncLinkType) Tag value: 17047552 (0x01042000)
Specifies the synchronization type for each connection.
Optional for all devices. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumSyncConnections-1. The type and name together uniquely identify a synchronization connection.

ConnectsToSyncNames is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17051648 (0x01043000)
Specifies the synchronization link name for each connection.
Optional for all devices. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumSyncConnections-1. An empty string indicates that a synchronization connection exists but is not connected. The type and name together uniquely identify a synchronization connection.

ProvidesSyncType is of type UnsignedInt (SyncLinkType) Tag value: 17055744 (0x01044000)
Specifies the synchronization type of the connection that this trigger bus represents.
Required for items that represent a trigger bus. The type and name together uniquely identify a synchronization connection.

ProvidesSyncName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17059840 (0x01045000)
Specifies the synchronization link name of the connection that this trigger bus represents.
Required for items that represent a trigger bus. The type and name together uniquely identify a synchronization connection. The product owner gets to say whether the string should make sense to a human, or be a GUID, or whatever.

NumSyncLines is of type Int Tag value: 17063936 (0x01046000)
Specifies the number of trigger lines that exist on the connection that this trigger bus represents.
Required for items that represent a trigger bus.

StaticSyncReservations is of type UnsignedInt (SyncReservationType) Tag value: 17068032 (0x01047000)
Specifies an array of reservations, one per trigger line.
Required for items that represent a trigger bus. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumSyncLines-1. These static reservations should be persisted across system restarts.

FirmwareSupportUpdate is of type Bool Tag value: 17080320 (0x0104A000)
Specifies whether the item supports firmware updates.
Optional for all devices. This specifies whether the expert supports updating or erasing the firmware for this item. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus.

FirmwareFilePattern is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17084416 (0x0104B000)
Specifies the file extension pattern of firmware filenames for this item.
Optional for all devices. This specifies the file extension pattern of firmware filenames for this item. Example: if the expert supports 1 file type the format should be like "*.bin". Example: if the expert supports 2 file types the format should be like "*.bin;*.cfg".

FirmwareAvailVerCount is of type Int Tag value: 17088512 (0x0104C000)
Specifies the number of available firmware versions, independent of the current version.
Optional for all devices. If the expert does not support predefined firmware versions, this should be 0. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

FirmwareAvailVer0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17092608 (0x0104D000)
Specifies the available firmware versions, independent of the current version.
Optional for all devices. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. FirmwareAvailVerCount-1 An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

OperatingSystemArch is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17096704 (0x0104E000)
Specifies the short form of the operating system running on a system, including its architecture.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). Examples: "PharLap", "VxWorks-PPC603", "Linux-ARMv7-A", "Windows x86", "Windows x64". Do not populate this on standalone devices where we do not want to expose the OS.

OperatingSystemVersion is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17100800 (0x0104F000)
Specifies the version of the operating system running on a system.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). This is the short form of the OS version, not intended for a UI. Anything after major.minor is not guaranteed. Example for PharLap: "13.1". Example for VxWorks-PPC603: "6.3". Example for Windows 7 (x86 or x64): "6.1.7601". Do not populate this on standalone devices where we do not want to expose the OS.

OperatingSystemDesc is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17104896 (0x01050000)
Specifies the long form of the operating system running on a system, including the name, version and service pack (if applicable).
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). Example: "Microsoft Windows 7 Professional (Service Pack 1)". Do not populate this on standalone devices where we do not want to expose the OS.

SystemBootTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 17108992 (0x01051000)
Specifies the time that the system last restarted.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3).

SystemBootSafeMode is of type Bool Tag value: 17113088 (0x01052000)
Specifies whether the system is currently running in safe mode.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3).

SystemBootDetails is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17117184 (0x01053000)
Specifies additional details about the system boot state.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). This describes the system boot state as it relates to SystemBootSafeMode. Examples: "Install Mode", "Safe Mode (Software Error)". Use standard strings from the expert and let the UI deal with localization.

DriverSupportRenameAlias0 is of type Bool Tag value: 17121280 (0x01054000)
Specifies whether the expert supports the user calling RenameAlias on this item.
Optional for all devices and chassis. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. NumberOfDrivers-1. This is a hint to the UI that the name field should be shown as writable. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. Not having this, or setting it to false, does not preclude the user from calling the method.

SupportDeviceReset is of type Bool Tag value: 17125376 (0x01055000)
Specifies whether the expert supports the user calling PerformDeviceReset on this item.
TODO: This will be deprecated in early 16.0 exports. Plan accordingly. Because this is deprecated, experts should set SupportDeviceResetModes rather than this property.

SupportSelfTest is of type Bool Tag value: 17129472 (0x01056000)
Specifies whether the expert supports the user calling DiagnosticSelfTest on this item.
TODO: This will be deprecated in early 16.0 exports. Plan accordingly. Because this is deprecated, experts should set SupportSelfTestModes rather than this property.

SystemCpuMaxSpeed is of type Int Tag value: 17133568 (0x01057000)
Specifies the maximum speed in MHz of the CPUs in the system.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). This property is not indexed because maximum CPU speed does not vary. If you really encounter that situation, return the maximum rate of the fastest CPU.

SystemCpuCount is of type Int Tag value: 17137664 (0x01058000)
Specifies the number of CPUs available in the system.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3).

SystemCpuLoadTotal0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17141760 (0x01059000)
Specifies the total load of each CPU as a number from 0-100.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SystemCpuCount-1. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

SystemCpuLoadIntr0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17145856 (0x0105A000)
Specifies the percentage of time each CPU spent in kernel tasks such as interrupts, DPC, and soft IRQs as a number from 0-100.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 5.3). These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SystemCpuCount-1. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

SensorVoltCount is of type Int Tag value: 17149952 (0x0105B000)
Specifies the number of voltage sensors available on this item.
Optional for all items.

SensorVoltName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17154048 (0x0105C000)
Specifies the name of each voltage sensor.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorVoltCount-1.

SensorVoltReading0 is of type Double Tag value: 17158144 (0x0105D000)
Specifies the current reading on each sensor, returned as the number of volts.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorVoltCount-1. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

SensorVoltNominal0 is of type Double Tag value: 17162240 (0x0105E000)
Specifies the nominal/expected reading for each sensor, returned as the number of volts.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorVoltCount-1.

SensorVoltLowerCritical0 is of type Double Tag value: 17166336 (0x0105F000)
Specifies the lower threshold of the documented critical range (normal operating range), returned as the number of volts.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorVoltCount-1.

SensorVoltUpperCritical0 is of type Double Tag value: 17170432 (0x01060000)
Specifies the upper threshold of the documented critical range (normal operating range), returned as the number of volts.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorVoltCount-1.

SensorFanCount is of type Int Tag value: 17174528 (0x01061000)
Specifies the number of fans available on this item.
Optional for all items.

SensorFanName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17178624 (0x01062000)
Specifies the name of each fan.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorFanCount-1.

SensorFanReading0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17182720 (0x01063000)
Specifies the current reading of each fan, returned as RPM.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorFanCount-1. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

SensorTempCount is of type Int Tag value: 17186816 (0x01064000)
Specifies the number of temperature sensors available on this item.
Optional for all items.

SensorTempName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17190912 (0x01065000)
Specifies the name of each temperature sensor.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorTempCount-1.

SensorTempReading0 is of type Double Tag value: 16965632 (0x0102E000)
Specifies the current temperature in degrees Celsius on each sensor.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorTempCount-1. Devices may support this property independently of whether they support calibration. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

SensorTempLowerCritical0 is of type Double Tag value: 17195008 (0x01066000)
Specifies the lower threshold of the documented critical range (normal operating range), returned as the number of degrees Celsius.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorTempCount-1.

SensorTempUpperCritical0 is of type Double Tag value: 17199104 (0x01067000)
Specifies the upper threshold of the documented critical range (normal operating range), returned as the number of degrees Celsius.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorTempCount-1.

UniqueAliasRequired is of type Int (UniqueAliasRequirement) Tag value: 17231872 (0x0106F000)
Specifies whether the item should be considered when searching for alias conflicts.
Optional for all items. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be "AliasRequirementUnknown".

RegiInterfacePath is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17235968 (0x01070000)
Specifies the interface path for use with niRegi (an internal tool for register access).
Optional for all devices and chassis. Experts that support niRegi with atomic devices should populate this property with the APAL token. This attribute is not intended to be made public.

TcpSupportUpdateSystemSettings is of type Bool Tag value: 17240064 (0x01071000)
Specifies whether the user can change the system settings on this property bag.
Optional for these devices: TCP/IP. If set to TRUE, the local expert supports changing the TcpPrimaryHostname and SystemUserComment. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. This forwards calls without requiring the user to connect directly to the network device or system.

SupportItemDelete is of type Bool Tag value: 17244160 (0x01072000)
Specifies whether the expert supports the user calling DeleteItem on this item.
Optional for all devices and chassis. If this property does not exist in a property bag then its value is assumed to be FALSE. Not having this, or setting it to false, does not preclude the user from calling the method. Unlike many other 'Support' properties, the value may be transient depending on IsPresentStatus.

OperationalState is of type UnsignedInt (OperationalState) Tag value: 17248256 (0x01073000)
Specifies the operational state of the device.
Optional for all devices and chassis. Operational states are categorized as warnings, errors, and/or normal states. Use the mask values to determine the what kind of state it is.

OrderablePartNumber is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17252352 (0x01074000)
Specifies the item's NI orderable part number.
Optional for all devices and chassis. Orderable NI part numbers are usually of the format "123456-78". This does not apply when IsProductNI is FALSE. If this is an NI product but the value is unknown, it should be an empty string.

HardwareRevision is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17256448 (0x01075000)
Specifies the hardware revision of the item.
Required for all devices and chassis (as of schema 15.0). This is usually a single letter, but successive revisions are not always in lexical order. A common sequence is A, B ... Y, Z, AA, BB. For products comprised of multiple circuit card assemblies, this field contains the module assembly revision. If the value is unknown it should be an empty string.

LifetimePowerOnHours is of type Int Tag value: 17260544 (0x01076000)
Specifies the total number of hours a product has been powered on in a system.
Optional for all devices and chassis. This is not the same as system uptime, which is merely the amount of time since it was last rebooted. Items in the same system may have different values if they were added to the system at different times. If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be -1.

PciPxiClock10 is of type Int (ClockSource) Tag value: 17264640 (0x01077000)
Specifies the PXI chassis clock source.
Required for these chassis: PXI (as of schema 15.0). If the value is unknown or unconfigured it should be Unknown (-1).

PciPxiLSpeedMax is of type Int (PciPxiLinkSpeed) Tag value: 17268736 (0x01078000)
Specifies the device's maximum supported link speed, in GT/s.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI (as of schema 15.0). These fields provide link speed information for PCI/PXI Express devices. This should not be confused with the link width. For PCI/PXI devices that are not Express devices, these fields must be set to Unknown (-1).

PciPxiLSpeedActual is of type Int (PciPxiLinkSpeed) Tag value: 17272832 (0x01079000)
Specifies the device's negotiated link speed, in GT/s.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI (as of schema 15.0). These fields provide link speed information for PCI/PXI Express devices. This should not be confused with the link width. For PCI/PXI devices that are not Express devices, these fields must be set to Unknown (-1).

SlotOffsetLeft is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17276928 (0x0107A000)
Specifies how many actual numbered slots to the left of the connected slot that a device takes up.
Required for these devices: PCI/PXI, VXI, and any other device in a chassis (as of schema 15.0). Calculate (SlotNumber - SlotOffsetLeft) to find the first occupied slot. Calculate (SlotNumber - SlotOffsetLeft + ConnectsToNumSlots - 1) to find the last occupied slot. This does not include unnumbered slots, such as the space occupied by system controllers. The value 0 means that the first numbered slot is the same as the connected slot. A client should treat the absence of this property the same as if it is populated with the value 0.

PhysElementLedCount is of type Int Tag value: 17281024 (0x0107B000)
Specifies the number of user LED indicators available on this item.
Optional for all items.

PhysElementLedName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17285120 (0x0107C000)
Specifies the name of each user LED indicator.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. PhysElementLedCount-1.

PhysElementLedState0 is of type UnsignedInt (LedState) Tag value: 17289216 (0x0107D000)
Specifies the current state for each user LED indicator.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. PhysElementLedCount-1. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

PhysElementSwitchCount is of type Int Tag value: 17293312 (0x0107E000)
Specifies the number of user switches available on this item.
Optional for all items.

PhysElementSwitchName0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17297408 (0x0107F000)
Specifies the name of each user switch.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. PhysElementSwitchCount-1.

PhysElementSwitchState0 is of type UnsignedInt (SwitchState) Tag value: 17301504 (0x01080000)
Specifies the current state for each user switch.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. PhysElementSwitchCount-1. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

IconIdentifier is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17305600 (0x01081000)
Specifies an identifier used to retrieve a visual resource (e.g. icon) to represent this item.
Optional for all items. This is not a path to an icon file. This is a application-agnostic identifier that the application can use to retrieve a visual resource to represent this item. The application may add text to this identifier to generate a filename or URI at which to locate an icon resource. The file format and size requirements are determined by the application using this identifier. This identifier must start with a letter or number and can contain only letters, numbers, periods, underscores, and dashes.

SystemCpuSpeed0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 17309696 (0x01082000)
Specifies the current speed in MHz of each CPU in the system.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 14.5). These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SystemCpuCount-1. This property is indexed because the current speed of each CPU may vary. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

SystemCpuModelName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 17313792 (0x01083000)
Specifies the model information of the CPUs in the system.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 14.5). This property is not indexed because all CPUs are the same model and version. This string may also include the vendor but that is platform dependent. On Linux-ARMv7-A this comes from the "Processor" field in /proc/cpuinfo. On Linux x64 this comes from the "model name" field in /proc/cpuinfo. On Mac OS this comes from the "machdep.cpu.brand_string" field when calling sysctl(). On Windows this comes from querying types 0x80000002, 0x80000003, and 0x80000004 when calling __cpuid().

SystemCpuSteppingRevision is of type Int Tag value: 17317888 (0x01084000)
Specifies the version number of the system CPUs within the same family name.
Optional for these services: LocalSystem (as of schema 14.5). This property is not indexed because all CPUs are the same model and version. On Linux-ARMv7-A this comes from the "Revision" field in /proc/cpuinfo. On Linux x64 this comes from the "stepping" field in /proc/cpuinfo. On Mac OS this comes from the "machdep.cpu.stepping" field when calling sysctl(). On Windows this comes from querying type 0x00000001 when calling __cpuid().

SupportDeviceResetModes is of type UnsignedInt (DeviceResetModes) Tag value: 17321984 (0x01085000)
Specifies whether the expert supports the user calling PerformDeviceReset on this item.
Optional for all devices and chassis. This is a hint to the UI to make a Reset command button visible and enabled. If multiple modes are supported, this is a hint to the UI to prompt the user for the mode to use. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. Not having this, or setting it to None, does not preclude the user from calling the method.

SupportSelfTestModes is of type UnsignedInt (SelfTestModes) Tag value: 17326080 (0x01086000)
Specifies whether the expert supports the user calling DiagnosticSelfTest on this item.
Optional for all devices and chassis. This is a hint to the UI to make a Self-Test command button visible and enabled. If multiple modes are supported, this is a hint to the UI to prompt the user for the mode to use. The bits convey the modes actually implemented, not those that succeed due to fall-back behavior. The value of this property is not transient and must not depend on IsPresentStatus. Not having this, or setting it to None, does not preclude the user from calling the method.

SensorVoltHealthState0 is of type Int (SensorHealthState) Tag value: 17330176 (0x01087000)
Specifies the current health state of each voltage sensor.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorVoltCount-1. This should be based on a numeric comparison of the sensor's current reading and each enabled threshold.

SensorFanHealthState0 is of type Int (SensorHealthState) Tag value: 17334272 (0x01088000)
Specifies the current health state of each fan.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorFanCount-1. This should be based on a numeric comparison of the sensor's current reading and each enabled threshold. The 'exceeded user-defined threshold' state does not apply since fans do not implement custom alarm settings.

SensorTempHealthState0 is of type Int (SensorHealthState) Tag value: 17338368 (0x01089000)
Specifies the current health state of each temperature sensor.
Optional for all items. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. SensorTempCount-1. This should be based on a numeric comparison of the sensor's current reading and each enabled threshold.

CoolingHealthSummary is of type Int (HealthSummary) Tag value: 17342464 (0x0108A000)
Specifies a summarized cooling health state for this device.
Optional for all devices. The summary factors in all relevant information for the device, including temperature. For simplicity, devices report a single cooling summary that indicates a discrete value reflecting its current cooling requirements. Monitoring cooling health enables devices to participate in system-level capabilities such as chassis fan speed control.

ProvidesPciPxiLWidthSlot0 is of type Int Tag value: 17346560 (0x0108B000)
Specifies the PXIe/PCIe link widths of each slot in this chassis.
Optional for these chassis: PXI. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. ProvidesNumSlots-1. Common values include 1, 4, and 8. This should not be confused with the link speed. For slots that cannot contain Express devices (e.g., system controller and PXI-1 slots), these fields must be -1.

ProvidesPciPxiLSpeedSlot0 is of type Int (PciPxiLinkSpeed) Tag value: 17350656 (0x0108C000)
Specifies the PXIe/PCIe link speeds of each slot in this chassis, in GT/s.
Optional for these chassis: PXI. These are indexable; iterate from 0 .. ProvidesNumSlots-1. This should not be confused with the link width. For slots that cannot contain Express devices (e.g., system controller and PXI-1 slots), these fields must be Unknown (-1).

WirelessNetworkSelection is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 218173440 (0x0D011000)
For internal use only. Reserved for Silverlight pages.

AdapterMode is of type UnsignedInt (AdapterMode) Tag value: 219160576 (0x0D102000)
Specifies the networking mode of the adapter (e.g. TCP/IP, EtherCAT, etc.).
Required for all network adapters. If the mode is EtherCAT, then only the EtherCAT Master ID is configurable for this adapter. If the mode is Disabled or GEV, then no other settings are configurable for this adapter. If the mode is any TcpIp value, all the attributes with 'Tcp' in the name are configurable for this adapter. If the mode is TcpIpWlan or TcpIpAccessPoint, the 'Tcp' properties as well as the appropriate 'Wlan' properties are configurable.

SupportedAdapterModes is of type UnsignedInt (AdapterMode) Tag value: 219164672 (0x0D103000)
Specifies a bit-set of all the supported networking modes of the adapter.
Required for all network adapters. When the property does not exist, assume that no adapter modes are supported ('None').

MACAddress is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219168768 (0x0D104000)
Specifies the MAC address of the network adapter.
Required for all network adapters. This is in the format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx where each xx is a hexadecimal value between 0x00 and 0xFF. This uniquely identifies a given network adapter over time.

TcpIPRequestMode is of type UnsignedInt (TcpIpRequestMode) Tag value: 219172864 (0x0D105000)
Specifies the method by which the adapter obtains an IPv4 address.
Required for all network adapters.

TcpSupportedIPRequestModes is of type UnsignedInt (TcpIpRequestMode) Tag value: 219176960 (0x0D106000)
Specifies a bit-set of which IPv4 address modes are supported by this network adapter.
Required for all network adapters.

TcpIPv4Address0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219181056 (0x0D107000)
Specifies the 4-byte IPv4 IP address.
Required when the AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. TcpIPv4AddressCount-1 Writable only when TcpIPRequestMode is 'Static'. The string is in the form x.x.x.x where x is (0..255). While most adapters only have one IPv4 Address, the address is an indexed attribute to allow for multiple IP addresses in the future.

TcpIPv4AddressCount is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219185152 (0x0D108000)
Specifies the number of IPv4 addresses associated with this network adapter.
Required when the AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpIPv4Subnet is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219189248 (0x0D109000)
Specifies the IPv4 subnet mask of the adapter.
Required when the AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. Writable only when TcpIPRequestMode is 'Static'. The string is in the form x.x.x.x where x is (0..255).

TcpIPv4Gateway is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219193344 (0x0D10A000)
Specifies the IPv4 default gateway for the adapter.
Required when the AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. Writable only when TcpIPRequestMode is 'Static'. The string is in the form x.x.x.x where x is (0..255).

TcpIPv4DnsServer is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219197440 (0x0D10B000)
Specifies the DNS server to use when obtaining an IPv4 address for the adapter.
Required when the AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. Writable only when TcpIPRequestMode is 'Static'. The string is in the form x.x.x.x where x is (0..255).

TcpIPv6Address is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219201536 (0x0D10C000)
Specifies the IPv6 address for the adapter.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. The string is formatted with hexadecimal digits and colon separators as defined on this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6_Addresses#Notation

TcpIPv6Gateway is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219205632 (0x0D10D000)
Specifies the IPv6 gateway for the adapter.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. The string is formatted with hexadecimal digits and colon separators as defined on this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6_Addresses#Notation

TcpIPv6DnsServer is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219209728 (0x0D10E000)
Specifies the DNS server to use when obtaining an IPv6 address for the adapter.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. The string is formatted with hexadecimal digits and colon separators as defined on this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6_Addresses#Notation

TcpPreferredLinkSpeed is of type UnsignedInt (TcpLinkSpeed) Tag value: 219213824 (0x0D10F000)
Specifies the preferred link speed selected by the user.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpSupportedLinkSpeeds is of type UnsignedInt (TcpLinkSpeed) Tag value: 219217920 (0x0D110000)
Specifies a bit-set of the supported link speeds from which the user can select.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpCurrentLinkSpeed is of type UnsignedInt (TcpLinkSpeed) Tag value: 219222016 (0x0D111000)
Specifies the current link speed of the adapter.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. If the adapter is not connected to a network, the link speed should be None.

TcpIsAutoCrossover is of type Bool Tag value: 219226112 (0x0D112000)
Specifies whether the adapter supports Auto-MDIX.
Optional for all network adapters.

TcpRequestPreviousIP is of type Bool Tag value: 219230208 (0x0D113000)
Specifies whether the adapter should explicitly request the same IP address from the DHCP server.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpLeaseObtainedTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 219238400 (0x0D115000)
Specifies the date and time when the DHCP lease was last acquired.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpLeaseExpireTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 219242496 (0x0D116000)
Specifies the date and time when the current DHCP lease will expire.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpMaxTransmissionUnit is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219246592 (0x0D117000)
Specifies the MTU of the adapter for use in Gigabit networks.
TODO: The .NET code checks for this but we don't ever put it in the bag. Should this be deprecated?

TcpSupportedPacketDetection is of type UnsignedInt (TcpPacketDetection) Tag value: 219254784 (0x0D119000)
Specifies a bit-set of the supported packet detections from which the user can select.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpCurrentPacketDetection is of type UnsignedInt (TcpPacketDetection) Tag value: 219258880 (0x0D11A000)
Specifies the current packet detection of the adapter.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values.

TcpPollingInterval is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219262976 (0x0D11B000)
Specifies the polling interval in milliseconds for TCP/IP polling packet detection.
Optional for network adapters when AdapterMode is one of the 'Tcp' values. The value must be between 1 and 10,000 inclusive.

EtherCATMasterID is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219250688 (0x0D118000)
Specifies the master ID for the EtherCAT adpater.
Required when the AdapterMode is EtherCAT. The value must be between 0 and 255 inclusive.

EtherCATMasterRedundancy is of type Bool Tag value: 219500544 (0x0D155000)
Specifies whether EtherCAR has Master Redundancy enabled.
Required when the AdapterMode is EtherCAT.

AdapterIsPrimary is of type Bool Tag value: 219308032 (0x0D126000)
Specifies whether this is the primary adapter.
Required for all network adapters.

AdapterType is of type UnsignedInt (AdapterType) Tag value: 219332608 (0x0D12C000)
Specifies the networking adapter type (e.g. Ethernet, 802.11 WLAN).
Required for all network adapters (as of schema 1.2).

WlanAvailableCount is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219365376 (0x0D134000)
Specifies the number of wireless networks discovered.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Call PopulateOrRefreshProperties on this property to initiate an SSID Scan.

WlanAvailableSsid0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219336704 (0x0D12D000)
Specifies the SSID of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableBssid0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219443200 (0x0D147000)
Specifies the BSSID of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableConnectionType0 is of type UnsignedInt (WlanConnectionType) Tag value: 219340800 (0x0D12E000)
Specifies the bit-set of available connection types of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableSecurityType0 is of type UnsignedInt (WlanSecurityType) Tag value: 219344896 (0x0D12F000)
Specifies the bit-set of available security types of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableLinkQuality0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219353088 (0x0D131000)
Specifies the link quality of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 The quality is expressed in the range from 0 to 100 inclusive. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableActualChannelNumber0 is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219357184 (0x0D132000)
Specifies the actual channel of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 Valid values for 2.4 GHz are 1 - 14. Valid values for 5 GHz include a non-consecutive range from 7 - 196. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableLinkSpeed0 is of type UnsignedInt (TcpLinkSpeed) Tag value: 219361280 (0x0D133000)
Specifies the link speed of a discovered wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanAvailableCount-1 An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanAvailableEapType0 is of type UnsignedInt (WlanEapType) Tag value: 219336704 (0x0D12D000)
Specifies the available EAP types of a discovered wireless network.
Because this is deprecated, experts should no longer set this property.

WlanSavedNetworksCount is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219373568 (0x0D136000)
Specifies the number of saved wireless networks.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Clients are expected to update the count when removing stored credentials for one or more APs.

WlanSavedNetworksSsid0 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219369472 (0x0D135000)
Specifies the SSID of a saved wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanSavedNetworksCount-1 Clients can write back to this list to remove stored credentials for one or more APs. Clients are also expected to update the count in WlanSavedNetworksCount.

WlanSavedNetworksConnectionType0 is of type UnsignedInt (WlanConnectionType) Tag value: 219455488 (0x0D14A000)
Specifies the connection type to use when connecting to the saved wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanSavedNetworksCount-1 Clients can write back to this list to remove stored credentials for one or more APs. Clients are also expected to update the count in WlanSavedNetworksCount.

WlanSavedNetworksSecurityType0 is of type UnsignedInt (WlanSecurityType) Tag value: 219459584 (0x0D14B000)
Specifies the security type to use when connecting to the saved wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is indexable; iterate from 0 .. WlanSavedNetworksCount-1 Clients can write back to this list to remove stored credentials for one or more APs. Clients are also expected to update the count in WlanSavedNetworksCount.

WlanCurrentSsid is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219377664 (0x0D137000)
Specifies the SSID of the current wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This should be blank when the wireless adapter is not connected.

WlanCurrentBssid is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219398144 (0x0D13C000)
Specifies the BSSID of the current wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. The BSSID is unique. Some access points can broadcast multiple BSSIDs each on a separate interface.

WlanCurrentConnectionType is of type UnsignedInt (WlanConnectionType) Tag value: 219381760 (0x0D138000)
Specifies the connection type of the current wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'.

WlanCurrentSecurityType is of type UnsignedInt (WlanSecurityType) Tag value: 219385856 (0x0D139000)
Specifies the security type of the current wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'.

WlanCurrentEapType is of type UnsignedInt (WlanEapType) Tag value: 219389952 (0x0D13A000)
Specifies the EAP type of the current wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan' and the WlanCurrentSecurityType is 'WpaEap'.

WlanCurrentLinkQuality is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219394048 (0x0D13B000)
Specifies the link quality of the current wireless network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. The quality is expressed in the range from 0 to 100 inclusive.

WlanPreferredChannelNumber is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219410432 (0x0D13F000)
Specifies the preferred channel (frequency) at which the wireless network transmits.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Valid values for 2.4 GHz are 1 - 14. Valid values for 5 GHz include a non-consecutive range from 7 - 196. We will likely add a special enumeration with values ChannelAny24GHz and ChannelAny5GHz in the future. The complete set of channel numbers is defined on this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_WLAN_channels

WlanActualChannelNumber is of type UnsignedInt Tag value: 219676672 (0x0D180000)
Specifies the actual channel (frequency) at which the wireless network transmits.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Valid values for 2.4 GHz are 1 - 14. Valid values for 5 GHz include a non-consecutive range from 7 - 196. This may differ from the preferred channel for a number of reasons. An expert should not populate this property until PopulateOrRefreshProperties.

WlanSupportedChannelNumbers is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219684864 (0x0D182000)
Specifies a comma-separated list of numeric values of supported channels.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. List elements may include channel numbers from 1 - 196. We will likely add a special enumeration with values ChannelAny24GHz and ChannelAny5GHz in the future. The supported channels list may change if you modify either WlanCountryCode or WlanIndoorUseOnly. The complete set of channel numbers is defined on this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_WLAN_channels

WlanSupportedEapTypes is of type UnsignedInt (WlanEapType) Tag value: 219553792 (0x0D162000)
Specifies a bit-set of the supported EAP types of the current wireless network.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan' and the WlanCurrentSecurityType is 'WpaEap'. When the property does not exist, assume that all EAP types are supported.

WlanSupportedConnectionTypes is of type UnsignedInt (WlanConnectionType) Tag value: 219557888 (0x0D163000)
Specifies a bit-set of the supported connection types of the current wireless network.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan' and the WlanCurrentSecurityType is 'WpaEap'. When the property does not exist, assume that all connection types are supported.

WlanBackgroundScanEnabled is of type Bool Tag value: 219402240 (0x0D13D000)
Specifies whether background scan is enabled.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. When set to 'true', the radio will continue to scan for better Access Points even while connected to one.

WlanCountryCode is of type Int Tag value: 219406336 (0x0D13E000)
Specifies the country in which the wireless adapter will operate.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Must be set before turning on the radio, because the country determines which channels (frequencies), speeds and connection types are allowed. The range is the ISO-3166-1 numeric values from this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_numeric

WlanCountryCodeLockCondition is of type UnsignedInt (WlanCountryCodeLockCondition) Tag value: 219426816 (0x0D143000)
Specifies whether the current country can be changed by the user.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This value is determined based on the country set during the manufacturing process. This field is necessary to comply with country-specific regulations. For example, the FCC in the USA has rules about which channels should be used for a wireless device.

WlanFactoryCountryCode is of type Int Tag value: 219451392 (0x0D149000)
Specifies the country to which the wireless adapter was shipped.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This value is set on the target by manufacturing. The range is the ISO-3166-1 numeric values from this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_numeric

WlanSecurityIdentity is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219414528 (0x0D140000)
Specifies the security identity.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is the username for WPA Enterprise.

WlanSecurityKey is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219418624 (0x0D141000)
Specifies the security key.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is the WEP key 0 or the WPA passphrase.

WlanClientCertificate is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219422720 (0x0D142000)
Specifies a client certificate used to authenticate with TLS.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is used for EAP-TLS on WPA/WPA2 Enterprise.

WlanSkipServerCertificateValidation is of type Bool Tag value: 219549696 (0x0D161000)
Specifies whether to skip validating the server (access point) endpoint using a certificate on EAP/PEAP networks.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Skipping validation is less secure, but means that a user does not have to upload certificates to connect to their network. When the property does not exist, assume that validation will take place.

WlanSupportedCreateConnectionTypes is of type UnsignedInt (WlanConnectionType) Tag value: 219430912 (0x0D144000)
Specifies the bit-set of connection types supported when the target creates a network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan' and the AdapterMode is 'TcpIpAccessPoint'.

WlanSupportedCreateAdHocSecurityTypes is of type UnsignedInt (WlanSecurityType) Tag value: 219435008 (0x0D145000)
Specifies the bit-set of security types supported when the target creates an ad-hoc network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan' and the AdapterMode is 'TcpIpAccessPoint'.

WlanSupportedCreateAccessPointSecurityTypes is of type UnsignedInt (WlanSecurityType) Tag value: 219439104 (0x0D146000)
Specifies the bit-set of security types supported when the target creates an infrastructure network.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan' and the AdapterMode is 'TcpIpAccessPoint'.

WlanConnectionStatus is of type UnsignedInt (WlanConnectionStatus) Tag value: 219447296 (0x0D148000)
Specifies the current connection status of the target.
Required when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. A call to PopulateOrRefreshProperties for this property should return immediately with the current status.

WlanQoSPriorityClass is of type UnsignedInt (WlanQoSPriorityClass) Tag value: 219463680 (0x0D14C000)
Specifies the current EDCA Access Category (AC) for this network adapter.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. This is defined in the Quality of Service enhancements for wireless LAN (IEEE 802.11e). This is the level of priority given to the traffic sent from this network adapter to an access point. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11e-2005

WlanSupportedQoSPriorityClasses is of type UnsignedInt (WlanQoSPriorityClass) Tag value: 219467776 (0x0D14D000)
Specifies a bit-set of all EDCA Access Categories (ACs) supported by this network adapter.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'.

WlanIndoorUseOnly is of type Bool Tag value: 219680768 (0x0D181000)
Specifies whether this wireless network will be limited to indoor use.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. Some countries limit the set of valid channels when a wireless network may be used outdoors.

WlanSupportedCountryCodes is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219688960 (0x0D183000)
Specifies a comma-separated list of numeric values of supported country codes in which the wireless adapter may operate.
Optional when the AdapterType is 'Wlan'. List elements include the 3-digit ISO-3166-1 numeric values for country codes as defined on this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_numeric

StateString is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 218169344 (0x0D010000)
For internal use only. Reserved for Silverlight pages.

HaltOnIPFailure is of type Bool Tag value: 219156480 (0x0D101000)
Specifies whether the system halts if it fails to acquire an IP address.
If true, when the TCP/IP stack fails to initialize on boot, the target will halt. For LabVIEW RT, the target will appear to reboot.

TcpFullDnsName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219234304 (0x0D114000)
Specifies the fully-qualified DNS name assigned by the DNS server.

ReservedBy is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219267072 (0x0D11C000)
Specifies the hostname of the host that has this target reserved.
Can be either be empty or not defined if the target is not reserved or if reservation is not supported by this target.

CurrentLocale is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219271168 (0x0D11D000)
Specifies the Microsoft-defined language code of the current locale.
The current set of NI-supported languages are: en, de, fr, ja, ko, zh-Hans

SupportedLocales is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219275264 (0x0D11E000)
Specifies a comma-separated list of the Microsoft-defined language codes of supported locales.
The current set of NI-supported languages are: en, de, fr, ja, ko, zh-Hans

CurrentTime is of type Timestamp Tag value: 219279360 (0x0D11F000)
Specifies the current time.

TimeZone is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219283456 (0x0D120000)
Specifies the timezone and daylight savings combined string.

CurrentTimeOffset is of type Int Tag value: 219328512 (0x0D12B000)
Specifies the offset of the current time with respect to UTC, in seconds.

TimeZoneOlson is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219471872 (0x0D14E000)
Specifies the timezone string as defined in the Olson database.
Examples include the following: America/New_York Europe/Berlin CST6CDT The database can found on this page: http://cs.ucla.edu/~eggert/tz/tz-link.htm

PwdProtectResets is of type Bool Tag value: 219287552 (0x0D121000)
Specifies whether the Restart operation should be password-protected.

UserData1 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219312128 (0x0D127000)
Specifies a user-defined field #1, in the format of an IP address.

UserData2 is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219316224 (0x0D128000)
Specifies a user-defined field #2, in the format of an IP address.

PrimaryChangeLocked is of type Bool Tag value: 219320320 (0x0D129000)
Specifies whether changing the primary adapter is locked.

PrimaryAdapterItemName is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219324416 (0x0D12A000)
Specifies the item name of the primary adapter.

Disk0Total is of type Double Tag value: 219291648 (0x0D122000)
Specifies the total size in KB of the primary hard drive.

Disk0Free is of type Double Tag value: 219295744 (0x0D123000)
Specifies the amount of free space in KB of the primary hard drive.

MemoryPhysTotal is of type Double Tag value: 219480064 (0x0D150000)
Specifies the total size in KB of physical memory.

MemoryPhysFree is of type Double Tag value: 219484160 (0x0D151000)
Specifies the amount of free space in KB of physical memory.

MemoryLargestBlock is of type Double Tag value: 219488256 (0x0D152000)
Specifies the largest available contiguous memory block size.
This is relevant only on legacy single-mode systems without virtual memory.

MemoryVirtTotal is of type Double Tag value: 219492352 (0x0D153000)
Specifies the total size in KB of virtual memory.

MemoryVirtFree is of type Double Tag value: 219496448 (0x0D154000)
Specifies the amount of free space in KB of virtual memory.

SystemConfigurationAccess is of type UnsignedInt (ConfigAccess) Tag value: 219504640 (0x0D156000)
Specifies from which machines the current system can be accessed.

CurrentFilesystem is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219508736 (0x0D157000)
Specifies the current filesystem of the primary hard drive.

SupportedFilesystems is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219512832 (0x0D158000)
Specifies a comma-separated list of the supported filesystems.

ImageDescription is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219516928 (0x0D159000)
Specifies the description of the last system image created from or set to a remote system.

ImageId is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219521024 (0x0D15A000)
Specifies the ID of the last system image created from or set to a remote system.

ImageTitle is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219525120 (0x0D15B000)
Specifies the title of the last system image created from or set to a remote system.

ImageVersion is of type UnicodeString Tag value: 219529216 (0x0D15C000)
Specifies the version of the last system image created from or set to a remote system.

SupportsWritableDipSwitches is of type Bool Tag value: 219533312 (0x0D15D000)
Specifies whether the target supports writable DIP switches.

UserDirectedSafeModeSwitch is of type Bool Tag value: 219537408 (0x0D15E000)
Specifies to boot into safe mode the next time the target is restarted.
If you set this property to FALSE, the target may still boot into safe mode if an error occurs or there is no software installed.

ConsoleOutSwitch is of type Bool Tag value: 219541504 (0x0D15F000)
Specifies to enable the console output the next time the target is restarted.

IpResetSwitch is of type Bool Tag value: 219545600 (0x0D160000)
Specifies to reset the network configuration to the factory default the next time the target is restarted.
